chunk:
attack.mitre.org/software/S0582) is a remote access trojan written in C++ that was used against at least three US utility companies in July 2019. The TALONITE activity group has been observed using [LookBack](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0582).(Citation: Proofpoint LookBack Malware Aug 2019)(Citation: Dragos TALONITE)(Citation: Dragos Threat Report 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Dok
Software description: [Dok](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0281) is a Trojan application disguised as a .zip file that is able to collect user credentials and install a malicious proxy server to redirect a user's network traffic (i.e. [Adversary-in-the-Middle](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1557)).(Citation: objsee mac malware 2017)(Citation: hexed osx.dok analysis 2019)(Citation: CheckPoint Dok)
Platforms: macOS

Software name: SUNBURST
Software description: [SUNBURST](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0559) is a trojanized DLL designed to fit within the SolarWinds Orion software update framework. It was used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) since at least February 2020.(Citation: SolarWinds Sunburst Sunspot Update January 2021)(Citation: Microsoft Deep Dive Solorigate January 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CrossRAT
Software description: [CrossRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0235) is a cross platform RAT.
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS

Software name: Aria-body
Software description: [Aria-body](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0456) is a custom backdoor that has been used by [Naikon](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0019) since approximately 2017.(Citation: CheckPoint Naikon May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Ryuk
Software description: [Ryuk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0446) is a ransomware designed to target enterprise environments that has been used in attacks since at least 2018. [Ryuk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0446) shares code similarities with Hermes ransomware.(Citation: CrowdStrike Ryuk January 2019)(Citation: FireEye Ryuk and Trickbot January 2019)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: KGH_SPY
Software description: [KGH_SPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0526) is a modular suite of tools used by [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) for reconnaissance, information stealing, and backdoor capabilities. [KGH_SPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0526) derived its name from PDB paths and internal names found in samples containing "KGH".(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SMOKEDHAM
Software description: [SMOKEDHAM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0649) is a Powershell-based .NET backdoor that was first reported in May 2021; it has been used by at least one ransomware-as-a-service affiliate.(Citation: FireEye Shining A Light on DARKSIDE May 2021)(Citation: FireEye SMOKEDHAM June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BADHATCH
Software description: [BADHATCH](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1081) is a backdoor that has been utilized by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) since at least 2019. [BADHATCH](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1081) has been used to target the insurance, retail, technology, and chemical industries in the United States, Canada, South Africa, Panama, and Italy.(Citation: Gigamon BADHATCH Jul 2019)(Citation: BitDefender BADHATCH Mar 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Olympic Destroyer
Software description: [Olympic Destroyer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0365) is malware that was used by [Sandworm Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0034) against the 2018 Winter Olympics, held in Pyeongchang, South Korea. The main purpose of the malware was to render infected computer systems inoperable. The malware leverages various native Windows utilities and API calls to carry out its destructive tasks. [Olympic Destroyer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0365) has worm-like features to spread itself across a computer network in order to maximize its destructive impact.(Citation: Talos Olympic Destroyer 2018)(Citation: US District Court Indictment GRU Unit 74455 October 2020) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Carberp
Software description: [Carberp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0484) is a credential and information stealing malware that has been active since at least 2009. [Carberp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0484)'s source code was leaked online in 2013, and subsequently used as the foundation for the [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) backdoor.(Citation: Trend Micro Carberp February 2014)(Citation: KasperskyCarbanak)(Citation:

entities.name: TALONITE
entities.description: TALONITE is an activity group that has been observed using the LookBack malware against US utility companies.

entities.name: LOOKBACK
entities.description: LookBack is a remote access trojan written in C++ used against US utility companies in July 2019.

entities.name: DOK
entities.description: Dok is a Trojan application disguised as a .zip file that collects user credentials and installs a malicious proxy server.

entities.name: SUNBURST
entities.description: SUNBURST is a trojanized DLL used within the SolarWinds Orion software update framework by APT29 since February 2020.

entities.name: CROSSRAT
entities.description: CrossRAT is a cross-platform remote access trojan (RAT).

entities.name: ARIA-BODY
entities.description: Aria-body is a custom backdoor used by the Naikon group since approximately 2017.

entities.name: RYUK
entities.description: Ryuk is ransomware targeting enterprise environments, used in attacks since at least 2018, sharing code similarities with Hermes ransomware.

entities.name: KGH_SPY
entities.description: KGH_SPY is a modular suite of tools used by Kimsuky for reconnaissance, information stealing, and backdoor capabilities.

entities.name: SMOKEDHAM
entities.description: SMOKEDHAM is a Powershell-based .NET backdoor first reported in May 2021, used by at least one ransomware-as-a-service affiliate.

entities.name: BADHATCH
entities.description: BADHATCH is a backdoor utilized by FIN8 since at least 2019, targeting various industries across multiple countries.

entities.name: OLYMPIC DESTROYER
entities.description: Olympic Destroyer is malware used by Sandworm Team against the 2018 Winter Olympics to render infected systems inoperable.

entities.name: CARBERP
entities.description: Carberp is credential and information stealing malware active since at least 2009, with its source code leaked in 2013.

entities.name: FIN8
entities.description: FIN8 is a cybercriminal group known for its ransomware attacks, including the use of BADHATCH malware targeting various industries.

entities.name: SANDWORM TEAM
entities.description: Sandworm Team is a Russian cyber warfare group responsible for various high-profile cyber attacks, including the Olympic Destroyer malware used against the 2018 Winter Olympics.

entities.name: NAIKON
entities.description: Naikon is a cyber espionage group known for its use of custom malware like Aria-body for reconnaissance and information stealing.

[Carberp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0484)'s source code was leaked online in 2013, and subsequently used as the foundation for the [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030) backdoor.(Citation: Trend Micro Carberp February 2014)(Citation: KasperskyCarbanak)(Citation: RSA Carbanak November 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: StrifeWater
Software description: [StrifeWater](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1034) is a remote-access tool that has been used by [Moses Staff](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1009) in the initial stages of their attacks since at least November 2021.(Citation: Cybereason StrifeWater Feb 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SHUTTERSPEED
Software description: [SHUTTERSPEED](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0217) is a backdoor used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067). (Citation: FireEye APT37 Feb 2018)
Platforms: None

Software name: Epic
Software description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) is a backdoor that has been used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010). (Citation: Kaspersky Turla)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: DustySky
Software description: [DustySky](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0062) is multi-stage malware written in .NET that has been used by [Molerats](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0021) since May 2015. (Citation: DustySky) (Citation: DustySky2)(Citation: Kaspersky MoleRATs April 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ProLock
Software description: [ProLock](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0654) is a ransomware strain that has been used in Big Game Hunting (BGH) operations since at least 2020, often obtaining initial access with [QakBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0650). [ProLock](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0654) is the successor to PwndLocker ransomware which was found to contain a bug allowing decryption without ransom payment in 2019.(Citation: Group IB Ransomware September 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Janicab
Software description: [Janicab](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0163) is an OS X trojan that relied on a valid developer ID and oblivious users to install it. (Citation: Janicab)
Platforms: macOS

Software name: Cyclops Blink
Software description: [Cyclops Blink](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0687) is a modular malware that has been used in widespread campaigns by [Sandworm Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0034) since at least 2019 to target Small/Home Office (SOHO) network devices, including WatchGuard and Asus.(Citation: NCSC Cyclops Blink February 2022)(Citation: NCSC CISA Cyclops Blink Advisory February 2022)(Citation: Trend Micro Cyclops Blink March 2022)
Platforms: Network

Software name: WarzoneRAT
Software description: [WarzoneRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0670) is a malware-as-a-service remote access tool (RAT) written in C++ that has been publicly available for purchase since at least late 2018.(Citation: Check Point Warzone Feb 2020)(Citation: Uptycs Warzone UAC Bypass November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Gelsemium
Software description: [Gelsemium](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0666) is a modular malware comprised of a dropper (Gelsemine), a loader (Gelsenicine), and main (Gelsevirine) plug-ins written using the Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC) framework. [Gelsemium](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0666) has been used by the Gelsemium group since at least 2014.(Citation: ESET Gelsemium June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: HOPLIGHT
Software description: [HOPLIGHT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0376) is a backdoor Trojan that has reportedly been used by the North Korean government.(Citation: US-CERT HOPLIGHT Apr 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: EvilBunny
Software description: [EvilBunny](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0396) is a C++ malware sample observed since 2011 that was designed to be a execution platform for Lua scripts.(Citation: Cyphort EvilBunny Dec 2014)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CrackMapExec
Software description: [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488), or CME, is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python and designed for penetration testing against networks. [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488) collects Active Directory information to conduct lateral movement through targeted networks.(Citation: CME Github September 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Green Lambert
Software description: [Green Lambert](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0690) is a modular backdoor that security

entities.name: CARBERP
entities.description: Carberp is a credential and information stealing malware that has been active since at least 2009, with its source code leaked online in 2013 and used as the foundation for the Carbanak backdoor.

entities.name: CARBANAK
entities.description: Carbanak is a backdoor malware that was developed using the Carberp source code and has been associated with various cyber attacks.

entities.name: MOSES STAFF
entities.description: Moses Staff is a group that has used the StrifeWater remote-access tool in the initial stages of their attacks since at least November 2021.

entities.name: STRIFEWATER
entities.description: StrifeWater is a remote-access tool used by Moses Staff for cyber attacks.

entities.name: APT37
entities.description: APT37 is a group that utilizes the SHUTTERSPEED backdoor in their operations.

entities.name: SHUTTERSPEED
entities.description: SHUTTERSPEED is a backdoor malware used by APT37 for cyber operations.

entities.name: TURLA
entities.description: Turla is a group known for using the Epic backdoor in their cyber attacks.

entities.name: EPIC
entities.description: Epic is a backdoor malware that has been used by the Turla group in various cyber operations.

entities.name: MOLERATS
entities.description: Molerats is a group that has been using DustySky multi-stage malware since May 2015.

entities.name: DUSTYSKY
entities.description: DustySky is a multi-stage malware written in .NET used by the Molerats group.

entities.name: PROLOCK
entities.description: ProLock is a ransomware strain used in Big Game Hunting operations since at least 2020, often gaining access through QakBot.

entities.name: JANICAB
entities.description: Janicab is an OS X trojan that relied on a valid developer ID and user ignorance for installation.

entities.name: CYCLONE BLINK
entities.description: Cyclops Blink is a modular malware used in campaigns by Sandworm Team to target SOHO network devices.

entities.name: WARZONERAT
entities.description: WarzoneRAT is a malware-as-a-service remote access tool available for purchase since at least late 2018.

entities.name: GELSEMIUM
entities.description: Gelsemium is a modular malware used by the Gelsemium group since at least 2014, consisting of various components.

entities.name: HOPLIGHT
entities.description: HOPLIGHT is a backdoor Trojan reportedly used by the North Korean government.

entities.name: EVILBUNNY
entities.description: EvilBunny is a C++ malware sample designed as an execution platform for Lua scripts, observed since 2011.

entities.name: CRACKMAPEXEC
entities.description: CrackMapExec is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python for penetration testing against networks.

entities.name: SANDWORM TEAM
entities.description: Sandworm Team is a hacking group known for its sophisticated cyber attacks and the use of Cyclops Blink malware.

entities.name: BIG GAME HUNTING
entities.description: Big Game Hunting (BGH) refers to a type of cybercrime operation where ransomware is deployed against high-value targets.

entities.name: CREDENTIAL STEALING
entities.description: Credential stealing refers to the act of obtaining sensitive information such as usernames and passwords, often through malware like Carberp.

entities.name: REMOTE-ACCESS TOOL
entities.description: Remote-access tools (RATs) are software that allow unauthorized access to a computer system, exemplified by tools like StrifeWater and WarzoneRAT.

entities.name: MALWARE
entities.description: Malware is a general term for malicious software designed to harm, exploit, or otherwise compromise computer systems, including various types like ransomware and backdoors.

<data key="d1">Big Game Hunting (BGH) refers to a type of cybercrime operation where ransomware is deployed against high-value targets.</data>      <data key="d2">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </node>    <node id="CREDENTIAL STEALING">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Credential stealing refers to the act of obtaining sensitive information such as usernames and passwords, often through malware like Carberp.</data>      <data key="d2">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </node>    <node id="REMOTE-ACCESS TOOL">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Remote-access tools (RATs) are software that allow unauthorized access to a computer system, exemplified by tools like StrifeWater and WarzoneRAT.</data>      <data key="d2">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </node>    <node id="MALWARE">      <data key="d0">EVENT</data>      <data key="d1">Malware is a general term for malicious software designed to harm, exploit, or otherwise compromise computer systems, including various types like ransomware and backdoors.</data>      <data key="d2">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </node>    <edge source="CARBERP" target="CARBANAK">      <data key="d4">8.0</data>      <data key="d5">Carberp's source code was leaked and subsequently used to create the Carbanak backdoor</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="CARBERP" target="CREDENTIAL STEALING">      <data key="d4">9.0</data>      <data key="d5">Carberp is specifically designed for credential stealing, making it a key player in this type of cybercrime</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="MOSES STAFF" target="STRIFEWATER">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">Moses Staff has utilized the StrifeWater remote-access tool in their cyber attacks</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="STRIFEWATER" target="REMOTE-ACCESS TOOL">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">StrifeWater is classified as a remote-access tool used in cyber attacks</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="APT37" target="SHUTTERSPEED">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">APT37 employs the SHUTTERSPEED backdoor in their operations</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="TURLA" target="EPIC">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">Turla uses the Epic backdoor in their cyber attacks</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="MOLERATS" target="DUSTYSKY">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">Molerats has been using DustySky malware in their operations since 2015</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="DUSTYSKY" target="MALWARE">      <data key="d4">1.0</data>      <data key="d5">DustySky is categorized as multi-stage malware used by the Molerats group</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="PROLOCK" target="QAKBOT">      <data key="d4">6.0</data>      <data key="d5">ProLock ransomware often gains initial access through QakBot</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="PROLOCK" target="BIG GAME HUNTING">      <data key="d4">8.0</data>      <data key="d5">ProLock ransomware is often used in Big Game Hunting operations targeting high-value organizations</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="CYCLONE BLINK" target="SANDWORM TEAM">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data key="d5">Sandworm Team has used Cyclops Blink malware in their campaigns</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="CYCLONE BLINK" target="MALWARE">      <data key="d4">8.0</data>      <data key="d5">Cyclops Blink is a type of malware used in widespread cyber campaigns</data>      <data a malware-as-a-service</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>    <edge source="WARZONERAT" target="REMOTE-ACCESS TOOL">      <data key="d4">7.0</data>      <data <data key="d5">CrackMapExec is designed for penetration testing against networks</data>      <data key="d6">fd987ef595b291a9fac8fcee46858d20</data>    </edge>  </graph></graphml>

chunk:
0488), or CME, is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python and designed for penetration testing against networks. [CrackMapExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0488) collects Active Directory information to conduct lateral movement through targeted networks.(Citation: CME Github September 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Green Lambert
Software description: [Green Lambert](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0690) is a modular backdoor that security researchers assess has been used by an advanced threat group referred to as Longhorn and The Lamberts. First reported in 2017, the Windows variant of [Green Lambert](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0690) may have been used as early as 2008; a macOS version was uploaded to a multiscanner service in September 2014.(Citation: Kaspersky Lamberts Toolkit April 2017)(Citation: Objective See Green Lambert for OSX Oct 2021)  
Platforms: Windows, iOS, macOS, Linux

Software name: KEYMARBLE
Software description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) is a Trojan that has reportedly been used by the North Korean government. (Citation: US-CERT KEYMARBLE Aug 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Ursnif
Software description: [Ursnif](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0386) is a banking trojan and variant of the Gozi malware observed being spread through various automated exploit kits, [Spearphishing Attachment](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1566/001)s, and malicious links.(Citation: NJCCIC Ursnif Sept 2016)(Citation: ProofPoint Ursnif Aug 2016) [Ursnif](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0386) is associated primarily with data theft, but variants also include components (backdoors, spyware, file injectors, etc.) capable of a wide variety of behaviors.(Citation: TrendMicro Ursnif Mar 2015)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SVCReady
Software description: [SVCReady](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1064) is a loader that has been used since at least April 2022 in malicious spam campaigns. Security researchers have noted overlaps between [TA551](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0127) activity and [SVCReady](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1064) distribution, including similarities in file names, lure images, and identical grammatical errors.(Citation: HP SVCReady Jun 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Maze
Software description: [Maze](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0449) ransomware, previously known as "ChaCha", was discovered in May 2019. In addition to encrypting files on victim machines for impact, [Maze](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0449) operators conduct information stealing campaigns prior to encryption and post the information online to extort affected companies.(Citation: FireEye Maze May 2020)(Citation: McAfee Maze March 2020)(Citation: Sophos Maze VM September 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Chrommme
Software description: [Chrommme](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0667) is a backdoor tool written using the Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC) framework that was first reported in June 2021; security researchers noted infrastructure overlaps with [Gelsemium](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0666) malware.(Citation: ESET Gelsemium June 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Azorult
Software description: [Azorult](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0344) is a commercial Trojan that is used to steal information from compromised hosts. [Azorult](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0344) has been observed in the wild as early as 2016.
In July 2018, [Azorult](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0344) was seen used in a spearphishing campaign against targets in North America. [Azorult](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0344) has been seen used for cryptocurrency theft. (Citation: Unit42 Azorult Nov 2018)(Citation: Proofpoint Azorult July 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Penquin
Software description: [Penquin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0587) is a remote access trojan (RAT) with multiple versions used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) to target Linux systems since at least 2014.(Citation: Kaspersky Turla Penquin December 2014)(Citation: Leonardo Turla Penquin May 2020)
Platforms: Linux

Software name: DOGCALL
Software description: [DOGCALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0213) is a backdoor used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067) that has been used to target South Korean government and military organizations in 2017. It is typically dropped using a Hangul Word Processor (HWP) exploit. (Citation: FireEye APT37 Feb 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Agent Tesla
Software description: [Agent Tesla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0331) is a spyware Trojan written for the .NET framework that has been observed since at least 2014.(Citation: Fortinet Agent Tesla April 2018)(Citation: Bitdefender Agent Tesla

entities.name: CME
entities.description: CME is a post-exploitation tool developed in Python for penetration testing against networks, specifically designed to collect Active Directory information for lateral movement.

entities.name: GREEN LAMBERT
entities.description: Green Lambert is a modular backdoor associated with an advanced threat group known as Longhorn and The Lamberts, first reported in 2017.

entities.name: KEYMARBLE
entities.description: KEYMARBLE is a Trojan reportedly used by the North Korean government, indicating its association with state-sponsored cyber activities.

entities.name: URSNIF
entities.description: Ursnif is a banking trojan and variant of Gozi malware, primarily associated with data theft and various malicious activities.

entities.name: SVCREADY
entities.description: SVCReady is a loader used in malicious spam campaigns, noted for its overlaps with TA551 activity.

entities.name: MAZE
entities.description: Maze is a ransomware that encrypts files on victim machines and conducts information stealing campaigns to extort companies.

entities.name: CHROMMME
entities.description: Chrommme is a backdoor tool written in the Microsoft Foundation Class framework, first reported in June 2021.

entities.name: AZORULT
entities.description: Azorult is a commercial Trojan used for information theft, observed in spearphishing campaigns and cryptocurrency theft.

entities.name: PENQUIN
entities.description: Penquin is a remote access trojan (RAT) used by Turla to target Linux systems since at least 2014.

entities.name: DOGCALL
entities.description: DOGCALL is a backdoor used by APT37 to target South Korean government and military organizations, typically dropped using a Hangul Word Processor exploit.

entities.name: AGENT TESLA
entities.description: Agent Tesla is a spyware Trojan written for the .NET framework, observed since at least 2014.

entities.name: TURNA
entities.description: Turla is a threat group known for using the Penquin remote access trojan to target Linux systems.

entities.name: APT37
entities.description: APT37 is a threat group that has used DOGCALL to target South Korean government and military organizations.

Platforms: Windows

Software name: Agent Tesla
Software description: [Agent Tesla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0331) is a spyware Trojan written for the .NET framework that has been observed since at least 2014.(Citation: Fortinet Agent Tesla April 2018)(Citation: Bitdefender Agent Tesla April 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Agent Tesla April 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Goopy
Software description: [Goopy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0477) is a Windows backdoor and Trojan used by [APT32](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0050) and shares several similarities to another backdoor used by the group ([Denis](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0354)). [Goopy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0477) is named for its impersonation of the legitimate Google Updater executable.(Citation: Cybereason Cobalt Kitty 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Sliver
Software description: [Sliver](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0633) is an open source, cross-platform, red team command and control framework written in Golang.(Citation: Bishop Fox Sliver Framework August 2019)
Platforms: Windows, Linux, macOS

Software name: Pillowmint
Software description: [Pillowmint](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0517) is a point-of-sale malware used by [FIN7](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0046) designed to capture credit card information.(Citation: Trustwave Pillowmint June 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ObliqueRAT
Software description: [ObliqueRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0644) is a remote access trojan, similar to [Crimson](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0115), that has been in use by [Transparent Tribe](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0134) since at least 2020.(Citation: Talos Oblique RAT March 2021)(Citation: Talos Transparent Tribe May 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: QUADAGENT
Software description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) is a PowerShell backdoor used by [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049). (Citation: Unit 42 QUADAGENT July 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Sardonic
Software description: [Sardonic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1085) is a backdoor written in C and C++ that is known to be used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061), as early as August 2021 to target a financial institution in the United States. [Sardonic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1085) has a plugin system that can load specially made DLLs and execute their functions.(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RegDuke
Software description: [RegDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0511) is a first stage implant written in .NET and used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) since at least 2017. [RegDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0511) has been used to control a compromised machine when control of other implants on the machine was lost.(Citation: ESET Dukes October 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: EVILNUM
Software description: [EVILNUM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0568) is fully capable backdoor that was first identified in 2018. [EVILNUM](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0568) is used by the APT group [Evilnum](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0120) which has the same name.(Citation: ESET EvilNum July 2020)(Citation: Prevailion EvilNum May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Carbon
Software description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) is a sophisticated, second-stage backdoor and framework that can be used to steal sensitive information from victims. [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) has been selectively used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) to target government and foreign affairs-related organizations in Central Asia.(Citation: ESET Carbon Mar 2017)(Citation: Securelist Turla Oct 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Smoke Loader
Software description: [Smoke Loader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0226) is a malicious bot application that can be used to load other malware.
[Smoke Loader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0226) has been seen in the wild since at least 2011 and has included a number of different payloads. It is notorious for its use of deception and self-protection. It also comes with several plug-ins. (Citation: Malwarebytes SmokeLoader 2016) (Citation: Microsoft Dofoil 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: LitePower
Software description: [LitePower](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0680) is a downloader and second stage malware that has been used by [WIRTE

entities.name: AGENT TESLA
entities.description: Agent Tesla is a spyware Trojan written for the .NET framework that has been observed since at least 2014, targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: GOOPY
entities.description: Goopy is a Windows backdoor and Trojan used by APT32, known for impersonating the legitimate Google Updater executable.

entities.name: SLIVER
entities.description: Sliver is an open source, cross-platform, red team command and control framework written in Golang.

entities.name: PILLOWMINT
entities.description: Pillowmint is a point-of-sale malware used by FIN7 designed to capture credit card information.

entities.name: OBLIQUERAT
entities.description: ObliqueRAT is a remote access trojan used by Transparent Tribe since at least 2020.

entities.name: QUADAGENT
entities.description: QUADAGENT is a PowerShell backdoor used by OilRig.

entities.name: SARDONIC
entities.description: Sardonic is a backdoor written in C and C++ used by FIN8 to target financial institutions in the United States.

entities.name: REGDUKE
entities.description: RegDuke is a first stage implant written in .NET used by APT29 since at least 2017.

entities.name: EVILNUM
entities.description: EVILNUM is a fully capable backdoor used by the APT group Evilnum, first identified in 2018.

entities.name: CARBON
entities.description: Carbon is a sophisticated, second-stage backdoor and framework used by Turla to target government and foreign affairs-related organizations in Central Asia.

entities.name: SMOKE LOADER
entities.description: Smoke Loader is a malicious bot application that can load other malware and has been seen in the wild since at least 2011.

entities.name: LITEPOWER
entities.description: LitePower is a downloader and second stage malware used by WIRTE.

entities.name: APT32
entities.description: APT32 is a cyber threat group that has been involved in various cyber espionage activities, particularly in Southeast Asia.

entities.name: FIN7
entities.description: FIN7 is a cybercriminal group known for its sophisticated attacks on financial institutions and point-of-sale systems.

entities.name: TRANSPARENT TRIBE
entities.description: Transparent Tribe is a cyber espionage group that has been active since at least 2016, primarily targeting Indian military and government organizations.

entities.name: OILRIG
entities.description: OilRig is a cyber threat group known for its attacks on organizations in the Middle East, particularly in the energy sector.

entities.name: FIN8
entities.description: FIN8 is a cybercriminal group that targets financial institutions, known for its use of sophisticated malware.

entities.name: WIRTE
entities.description: WIRTE is a cyber threat group known for its use of malware in targeted attacks against various sectors.)<|COMPLETE|>

chunk:
2011 and has included a number of different payloads. It is notorious for its use of deception and self-protection. It also comes with several plug-ins. (Citation: Malwarebytes SmokeLoader 2016) (Citation: Microsoft Dofoil 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: LitePower
Software description: [LitePower](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0680) is a downloader and second stage malware that has been used by [WIRTE](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0090) since at least 2021.(Citation: Kaspersky WIRTE November 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: POWERSTATS
Software description: [POWERSTATS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0223) is a PowerShell-based first stage backdoor used by [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069). (Citation: Unit 42 MuddyWater Nov 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TURNEDUP
Software description: [TURNEDUP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0199) is a non-public backdoor. It has been dropped by [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064)'s [StoneDrill](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0380) malware. (Citation: FireEye APT33 Sept 2017) (Citation: FireEye APT33 Webinar Sept 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Uroburos
Software description: [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) is a sophisticated cyber espionage tool written in C that has been used by units within Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) associated with the [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) toolset to collect intelligence on sensitive targets worldwide. [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) has several variants and has undergone nearly constant upgrade since its initial development in 2003 to keep it viable after public disclosures. [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) is typically deployed to external-facing nodes on a targeted network and has the ability to leverage additional tools and TTPs to further exploit an internal network. [Uroburos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0022) has interoperable implants for Windows, Linux, and macOS, employs a high level of stealth in communications and architecture, and can easily incorporate new or replacement components.(Citation: Joint Cybersecurity Advisory AA23-129A Snake Malware May 2023)(Citation: Kaspersky Turla)
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS

Software name: Micropsia
Software description: [Micropsia](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0339) is a remote access tool written in Delphi.(Citation: Talos Micropsia June 2017)(Citation: Radware Micropsia July 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Octopus
Software description: [Octopus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0340) is a Windows Trojan written in the Delphi programming language that has been used by [Nomadic Octopus](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0133) to target government organizations in Central Asia since at least 2014.(Citation: Securelist Octopus Oct 2018)(Citation: Security Affairs DustSquad Oct 2018)(Citation: ESET Nomadic Octopus 2018) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: FunnyDream
Software description: [FunnyDream](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1044) is a backdoor with multiple components that was used during the [FunnyDream](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0007) campaign since at least 2019, primarily for execution and exfiltration.(Citation: Bitdefender FunnyDream Campaign November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: MoleNet
Software description: [MoleNet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0553) is a downloader tool with backdoor capabilities that has been observed in use since at least 2019.(Citation: Cybereason Molerats Dec 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Chaes
Software description: [Chaes](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0631) is a multistage information stealer written in several programming languages that collects login credentials, credit card numbers, and other financial information. [Chaes](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0631) was first observed in 2020, and appears to primarily target victims in Brazil as well as other e-commerce customers in Latin America.(Citation: Cybereason Chaes Nov 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Matryoshka
Software description: [Matryoshka](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0167) is a malware framework used by [CopyKittens](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0052) that consists of a dropper, loader, and RAT. It has multiple versions; v1 was seen in the wild from July 2016 until January 2017. v2 has fewer commands and other minor differences. (Citation: ClearSky Wilted Tulip July 2017) (Citation: CopyKittens Nov 2015)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SysUpdate
Software description: [SysUpdate](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0663) is a backdoor written in C++ that has been used by [Threat Group-3390](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0027) since at least 2020

entities.name: LITEPOWER
entities.description: LitePower is a downloader and second stage malware used by the WIRTE group since at least 2021, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: POWERSTATS
entities.description: POWERSTATS is a PowerShell-based first stage backdoor utilized by the MuddyWater group, designed for Windows platforms.

entities.name: TURNEDUP
entities.description: TURNEDUP is a non-public backdoor dropped by APT33's StoneDrill malware, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: UROBUROS
entities.description: Uroburos is a sophisticated cyber espionage tool used by Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) associated with the Turla toolset, targeting sensitive information globally across multiple platforms.

entities.name: MICROPSIA
entities.description: Micropsia is a remote access tool written in Delphi, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: OCTOPUS
entities.description: Octopus is a Windows Trojan used by Nomadic Octopus to target government organizations in Central Asia since at least 2014.

entities.name: FUNNYDREAM
entities.description: FunnyDream is a backdoor with multiple components used during the FunnyDream campaign since at least 2019 for execution and exfiltration.

entities.name: MOLENET
entities.description: MoleNet is a downloader tool with backdoor capabilities observed in use since at least 2019, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: CHAES
entities.description: Chaes is a multistage information stealer that collects sensitive financial information, primarily targeting victims in Brazil and Latin America since 2020.

entities.name: MATRYOSHKA
entities.description: Matryoshka is a malware framework used by CopyKittens, consisting of a dropper, loader, and RAT, with multiple versions observed in the wild.

entities.name: SYSUPDATE
entities.description: SysUpdate is a backdoor written in C++ used by Threat Group-3390 since at least 2020.

entities.name: MUDDYWATER
entities.description: MuddyWater is a cyber threat group that has been linked to the use of POWERSTATS malware.

entities.name: APT33
entities.description: APT33 is a hacking group known for its cyber espionage activities, particularly in relation to TURNEDUP malware.

entities.name: TURLA
entities.description: Turla is a cyber espionage group associated with the Uroburos malware, targeting sensitive information globally.

entities.name: NOMADIC OCTOPUS
entities.description: Nomadic Octopus is a cyber threat group that has utilized the Octopus Trojan to target government organizations.

entities.name: COPYKITTENS
entities.description: CopyKittens is a cyber threat group known for using the Matryoshka malware framework in its operations.

entities.name: THREAT GROUP-3390
entities.description: Threat Group-3390 is a hacking group known for using the SysUpdate backdoor in its cyber operations.

entities.name: MICROSOFT
entities.description: Microsoft is a technology company that has reported on various malware threats, including Dofoil.

entities.name: SMOKELOADER
entities.description: SmokeLoader is a notorious downloader malware known for its use of deception and self-protection, often associated with various cybercriminal activities.

entities.name: DOFOIL
entities.description: Dofoil is a type of malware that has been reported by Microsoft, known for its capabilities in cyber attacks.

entities.name: FIRUZABAD
entities.description: Firuzabad is a geographical location associated with various cyber activities and malware operations.

entities.name: KROHAARA
entities.description: Krohaara is a geographical location mentioned in the context of cyber operations and malware activities.

entities.name: CASHION
entities.description: Cashion is a geographical location referenced in relation to cyber activities and malware operations.

and other minor differences. (Citation: ClearSky Wilted Tulip July 2017) (Citation: CopyKittens Nov 2015)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SysUpdate
Software description: [SysUpdate](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0663) is a backdoor written in C++ that has been used by [Threat Group-3390](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0027) since at least 2020.(Citation: Trend Micro Iron Tiger April 2021)
Platforms: Windows, Linux

Software name: MCMD
Software description: [MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) is a remote access tool that provides remote command shell capability used by [Dragonfly 2.0](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0074).(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SoreFang
Software description: [SoreFang](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0516) is first stage downloader used by [APT29](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0016) for exfiltration and to load other malware.(Citation: NCSC APT29 July 2020)(Citation: CISA SoreFang July 2016)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Dyre
Software description: [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024) is a banking Trojan that has been used for financial gain. 
 (Citation: Symantec Dyre June 2015)(Citation: Malwarebytes Dyreza November 2015)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: zwShell
Software description: [zwShell](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0350) is a remote access tool (RAT) written in Delphi that has been seen in the wild since the spring of 2010 and used by threat actors during [Night Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0002).(Citation: McAfee Night Dragon)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: SUGARDUMP
Software description: [SUGARDUMP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1042) is a proprietary browser credential harvesting tool that was used by UNC3890 during the [C0010](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0010) campaign. The first known [SUGARDUMP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1042) version was used since at least early 2021, a second SMTP C2 version was used from late 2021-early 2022, and a third HTTP C2 variant was used since at least April 2022.(Citation: Mandiant UNC3890 Aug 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Power Loader
Software description: [Power Loader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0177) is modular code sold in the cybercrime market used as a downloader in malware families such as Carberp, Redyms and Gapz. (Citation: MalwareTech Power Loader Aug 2013) (Citation: WeLiveSecurity Gapz and Redyms Mar 2013)
Platforms: None

Software name: QakBot
Software description: [QakBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0650) is a modular banking trojan that has been used primarily by financially-motivated actors since at least 2007. [QakBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0650) is continuously maintained and developed and has evolved from an information stealer into a delivery agent for ransomware, most notably [ProLock](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0654) and [Egregor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0554).(Citation: Trend Micro Qakbot December 2020)(Citation: Red Canary Qbot)(Citation: Kaspersky QakBot September 2021)(Citation: ATT QakBot April 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: XAgentOSX
Software description: [XAgentOSX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0161) is a trojan that has been used by [APT28](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0007)  on OS X and appears to be a port of their standard [CHOPSTICK](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0023) or XAgent trojan. (Citation: XAgentOSX 2017)
Platforms: macOS

Software name: AppleSeed
Software description: [AppleSeed](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0622) is a backdoor that has been used by [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) to target South Korean government, academic, and commercial  targets since at least 2021.(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)
Platforms: Windows, Android

Software name: Zeus Panda
Software description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) is a Trojan designed to steal banking information and other sensitive credentials for exfiltration. [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330)’s original source code was leaked in 2011, allowing threat actors to use its source code as a basis for new malware variants. It is mainly used to target Windows operating systems ranging from Windows XP through Windows 10.(Citation: Talos Zeus Panda Nov 2017)(Citation: GDATA Zeus Panda June 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: KONNI
Software description: [KONNI](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0356) is a remote access tool

Platforms: Windows

Software name: KONNI
Software description: [KONNI](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0356) is a remote access tool that security researchers assess has been used by North Korean cyber actors since at least 2014. [KONNI](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0356) has significant code overlap with the [NOKKI](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0353) malware family, and has been linked to several suspected North Korean campaigns targeting political organizations in Russia, East Asia, Europe and the Middle East; there is some evidence potentially linking [KONNI](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0356) to [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067).(Citation: Talos Konni May 2017)(Citation: Unit 42 NOKKI Sept 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Nokki Oct 2018)(Citation: Medium KONNI Jan 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Konni Aug 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: DarkTortilla
Software description: [DarkTortilla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1066) is a highly configurable .NET-based crypter that has been possibly active since at least August 2015. [DarkTortilla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1066) has been used to deliver popular information stealers, RATs, and payloads such as [Agent Tesla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0331), AsyncRat, [NanoCore](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0336), RedLine, [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154), and Metasploit.(Citation: Secureworks DarkTortilla Aug 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Lucifer
Software description: [Lucifer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0532) is a crypto miner and DDoS hybrid malware that leverages well-known exploits to spread laterally on Windows platforms.(Citation: Unit 42 Lucifer June 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Pupy
Software description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) is an open source, cross-platform (Windows, Linux, OSX, Android) remote administration and post-exploitation tool. (Citation: GitHub Pupy) It is written in Python and can be generated as a payload in several different ways (Windows exe, Python file, PowerShell oneliner/file, Linux elf, APK, Rubber Ducky, etc.). (Citation: GitHub Pupy) [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) is publicly available on GitHub. (Citation: GitHub Pupy)
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS, Android

Software name: Crutch
Software description: [Crutch](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0538) is a backdoor designed for document theft that has been used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) since at least 2015.(Citation: ESET Crutch December 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: AppleJeus
Software description: [AppleJeus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0584) is a family of downloaders initially discovered in 2018 embedded within trojanized cryptocurrency applications. [AppleJeus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0584) has been used by [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032), targeting companies in the energy, finance, government, industry, technology, and telecommunications sectors, and several countries including the United States, United Kingdom, South Korea, Australia, Brazil, New Zealand, and Russia. [AppleJeus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0584) has been used to distribute the [FALLCHILL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0181) RAT.(Citation: CISA AppleJeus Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows, macOS

Software name: Duqu
Software description: [Duqu](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0038) is a malware platform that uses a modular approach to extend functionality after deployment within a target network. (Citation: Symantec W32.Duqu)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Zebrocy
Software description: [Zebrocy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0251) is a Trojan that has been used by [APT28](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0007) since at least November 2015. The malware comes in several programming language variants, including C++, Delphi, AutoIt, C#, VB.NET, and Golang. (Citation: Palo Alto Sofacy 06-2018)(Citation: Unit42 Cannon Nov 2018)(Citation: Unit42 Sofacy Dec 2018)(Citation: CISA Zebrocy Oct 2020) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Kasidet
Software description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) is a backdoor that has been dropped by using malicious VBA macros. (Citation: Zscaler Kasidet)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: QuietSieve

entities.name: KONNI
entities.description: KONNI is a remote access tool used by North Korean cyber actors since at least 2014, with significant code overlap with the NOKKI malware family, targeting political organizations in various regions.

entities.name: NOKKI
entities.description: NOKKI is a malware family that shares significant code with KONNI and has been linked to North Korean cyber campaigns.

entities.name: DARK TORTILLA
entities.description: DarkTortilla is a .NET-based crypter that has been active since at least August 2015, used to deliver various types of malware.

entities.name: LUCIFER
entities.description: Lucifer is a hybrid malware that functions as a crypto miner and DDoS tool, exploiting vulnerabilities on Windows platforms.

entities.name: PUPY
entities.description: Pupy is an open-source remote administration tool that operates across multiple platforms, including Windows, Linux, and Android.

entities.name: CRUTCH
entities.description: Crutch is a backdoor used for document theft, associated with the Turla group since at least 2015.

entities.name: APPLEJEUS
entities.description: AppleJeus is a family of downloaders embedded in trojanized cryptocurrency applications, used by the Lazarus Group to target various sectors globally.

entities.name: DUQU
entities.description: Duqu is a modular malware platform that extends its functionality after deployment within a target network.

entities.name: ZEBROCY
entities.description: Zebrocy is a Trojan used by APT28 since at least November 2015, available in multiple programming language variants.

entities.name: KASIDET
entities.description: Kasidet is a backdoor that is deployed using malicious VBA macros.

entities.name: TURLA
entities.description: Turla is a cyber espionage group known for using various malware, including Crutch, for document theft.

entities.name: APT28
entities.description: APT28 is a Russian cyber espionage group known for using Zebrocy and other malware in its operations.

entities.name: NORTH KOREA
entities.description: North Korea is a country associated with the development and use of KONNI and other malware by its cyber actors.

entities.name: LAZARUS GROUP
entities.description: Lazarus Group is a North Korean cybercrime group that has utilized AppleJeus for targeting various sectors globally.

entities.name: APT37
entities.description: APT37 is a North Korean cyber threat group linked to KONNI and other cyber campaigns.

2018)(Citation: CISA Zebrocy Oct 2020) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Kasidet
Software description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) is a backdoor that has been dropped by using malicious VBA macros. (Citation: Zscaler Kasidet)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: QuietSieve
Software description: [QuietSieve](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0686) is an information stealer that has been used by [Gamaredon Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0047) since at least 2021.(Citation: Microsoft Actinium February 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: certutil
Software description: [certutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0160) is a command-line utility that can be used to obtain certificate authority information and configure Certificate Services. (Citation: TechNet Certutil)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: UPPERCUT
Software description: [UPPERCUT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0275) is a backdoor that has been used by [menuPass](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0045). (Citation: FireEye APT10 Sept 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Koadic
Software description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) is a Windows post-exploitation framework and penetration testing tool that is publicly available on GitHub. [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) has several options for staging payloads and creating implants, and performs most of its operations using Windows Script Host.(Citation: Github Koadic)(Citation: Palo Alto Sofacy 06-2018)(Citation: MalwareBytes LazyScripter Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RogueRobin
Software description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) is a payload used by [DarkHydrus](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0079) that has been developed in PowerShell and C#. (Citation: Unit 42 DarkHydrus July 2018)(Citation: Unit42 DarkHydrus Jan 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PipeMon
Software description: [PipeMon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0501) is a multi-stage modular backdoor used by [Winnti Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0044).(Citation: ESET PipeMon May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PowerShower
Software description: [PowerShower](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0441) is a PowerShell backdoor used by [Inception](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0100) for initial reconnaissance and to download and execute second stage payloads.(Citation: Unit 42 Inception November 2018)(Citation: Kaspersky Cloud Atlas August 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Brute Ratel C4
Software description: [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) is a commercial red-teaming and adversarial attack simulation tool that first appeared in December 2020. [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was specifically designed to avoid detection by endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus (AV) capabilities, and deploys agents called badgers to enable arbitrary command execution for lateral movement, privilege escalation, and persistence. In September 2022, a cracked version of [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was leaked in the cybercriminal underground, leading to its use by threat actors.(Citation: Dark Vortex Brute Ratel C4)(Citation: Palo Alto Brute Ratel July 2022)(Citation: MDSec Brute Ratel August 2022)(Citation: SANS Brute Ratel October 2022)(Citation: Trend Micro Black Basta October 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CORALDECK
Software description: [CORALDECK](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0212) is an exfiltration tool used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067). (Citation: FireEye APT37 Feb 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: VERMIN
Software description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) is a remote access tool written in the Microsoft .NET framework. It is mostly composed of original code, but also has some open source code. (Citation: Unit 42 VERMIN Jan 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PyDCrypt
Software description: [PyDCrypt](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1032) is malware written in Python designed to deliver [DCSrv](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1033). It has been used by [Moses Staff](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1009) since at least September 2021, with each sample tailored for its intended victim organization.(Citation: Checkpoint MosesStaff Nov 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: NKAbuse
Software description: [NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) is a Go-based, multi-platform malware abusing NKN (New Kind of Network) technology for data exchange between peers, functioning as a potent implant, and equipped with both flooder and backdoor capabilities.(Citation: NKAbuse

entities.name: KASIDET
entities.description: Kasidet is a backdoor software that has been dropped using malicious VBA macros, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: QUIETSIEVE
entities.description: QuietSieve is an information stealer used by the Gamaredon Group since at least 2021, targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: CERTUTIL
entities.description: Certutil is a command-line utility for obtaining certificate authority information and configuring Certificate Services, used on Windows platforms.

entities.name: UPPERCUT
entities.description: UPPERCUT is a backdoor software utilized by menuPass, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: KOADIC
entities.description: Koadic is a Windows post-exploitation framework and penetration testing tool available on GitHub, used for staging payloads and creating implants.

entities.name: ROGUEROBIN
entities.description: RogueRobin is a payload developed in PowerShell and C# used by DarkHydrus, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: PIPEMON
entities.description: PipeMon is a multi-stage modular backdoor used by the Winnti Group, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: POWERSHOWER
entities.description: PowerShower is a PowerShell backdoor used by Inception for reconnaissance and downloading second stage payloads, targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: BRUTE RATEL C4
entities.description: Brute Ratel C4 is a commercial red-teaming tool designed to avoid detection, enabling command execution for lateral movement and persistence, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: CORALDECK
entities.description: CORALDECK is an exfiltration tool used by APT37, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: VERMIN
entities.description: VERMIN is a remote access tool written in .NET, composed of original and open-source code, primarily targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: PYDCRYPT
entities.description: PyDCrypt is malware written in Python designed to deliver DCSrv, used by Moses Staff since at least September 2021, targeting Windows platforms.

entities.name: NKABUSE
entities.description: NKAbuse is a Go-based malware that abuses NKN technology for data exchange, functioning as an implant with flooder and backdoor capabilities.

entities.name: MENU PASS
entities.description: menuPass is a cyber threat actor that utilizes backdoor software like UPPERCUT in its operations.

entities.name: DARKHYDRUS
entities.description: DarkHydrus is a cyber threat actor that develops malware such as RogueRobin for malicious activities.

entities.name: WINNTI GROUP
entities.description: Winnti Group is a cyber threat actor known for using multi-stage modular backdoors like PipeMon.

entities.name: INCEPTION
entities.description: Inception is a cyber threat actor that employs PowerShell backdoors like PowerShower for reconnaissance and payload delivery.

entities.name: APT37
entities.description: APT37 is a cyber threat group that uses exfiltration tools like CORALDECK in its operations.

entities.name: MOSES STAFF
entities.description: Moses Staff is a cyber threat actor known for using malware like PyDCrypt to deliver malicious payloads.

entities.name: MULTI-PLATFORM MALWARE
entities.description: Multi-platform malware refers to malicious software like NKAbuse that can operate across different operating systems and environments.)<|COMPLETE|>

chunk:
, with each sample tailored for its intended victim organization.(Citation: Checkpoint MosesStaff Nov 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: NKAbuse
Software description: [NKAbuse](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1107) is a Go-based, multi-platform malware abusing NKN (New Kind of Network) technology for data exchange between peers, functioning as a potent implant, and equipped with both flooder and backdoor capabilities.(Citation: NKAbuse BC)(Citation: NKAbuse SL)
Platforms: Linux, macOS, Windows

Software name: Kivars
Software description: [Kivars](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0437) is a modular remote access tool (RAT), derived from the Bifrost RAT, that was used by [BlackTech](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0098) in a 2010 campaign.(Citation: TrendMicro BlackTech June 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ZLib
Software description: [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) is a full-featured backdoor that was used as a second-stage implant during [Operation Dust Storm](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0016) since at least 2014. [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) is malware and should not be confused with the legitimate compression library from which its name is derived.(Citation: Cylance Dust Storm)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Rclone
Software description: [Rclone](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1040) is a command line program for syncing files with cloud storage services such as Dropbox, Google Drive, Amazon S3, and MEGA. [Rclone](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1040) has been used in a number of ransomware campaigns, including those associated with the [Conti](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0575) and DarkSide Ransomware-as-a-Service operations.(Citation: Rclone)(Citation: Rclone Wars)(Citation: Detecting Rclone)(Citation: DarkSide Ransomware Gang)(Citation: DFIR Conti Bazar Nov 2021)
Platforms: Linux, Windows, macOS

Software name: Machete
Software description: [Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0409) is a cyber espionage toolset used by [Machete](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0095). It is a Python-based backdoor targeting Windows machines that was first observed in 2010.(Citation: ESET Machete July 2019)(Citation: Securelist Machete Aug 2014)(Citation: 360 Machete Sep 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ROKRAT
Software description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) is a cloud-based remote access tool (RAT) used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067) to target victims in South Korea. [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067) has used ROKRAT during several campaigns from 2016 through 2021.(Citation: Talos ROKRAT)(Citation: Talos Group123)(Citation: Volexity InkySquid RokRAT August 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: XCSSET
Software description: [XCSSET](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0658) is a macOS modular backdoor that targets Xcode application developers. [XCSSET](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0658) was first observed in August 2020 and has been used to install a backdoor component, modify browser applications, conduct collection, and provide ransomware-like encryption capabilities.(Citation: trendmicro xcsset xcode project 2020)
Platforms: macOS

Software name: Gazer
Software description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) is a backdoor used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) since at least 2016. (Citation: ESET Gazer Aug 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Cardinal RAT
Software description: [Cardinal RAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0348) is a potentially low volume remote access trojan (RAT) observed since December 2015. [Cardinal RAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0348) is notable for its unique utilization of uncompiled C# source code and the Microsoft Windows built-in csc.exe compiler.(Citation: PaloAlto CardinalRat Apr 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Lokibot
Software description: [Lokibot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0447) is a widely distributed information stealer that was first reported in 2015. It is designed to steal sensitive information such as usernames, passwords, cryptocurrency wallets, and other credentials. [Lokibot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0447) can also create a backdoor into infected systems to allow an attacker to install additional payloads.(Citation: Infoblox Lokibot January 2019)(Citation: Morphisec Lokibot April 2020)(Citation: CISA Lokibot September 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: FlawedAmmyy
Software description: [FlawedAmmyy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0381) is a remote access tool (RAT) that was first seen in early 2016. The

chunk:
additional payloads.(Citation: Infoblox Lokibot January 2019)(Citation: Morphisec Lokibot April 2020)(Citation: CISA Lokibot September 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: FlawedAmmyy
Software description: [FlawedAmmyy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0381) is a remote access tool (RAT) that was first seen in early 2016. The code for [FlawedAmmyy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0381) was based on leaked source code for a version of Ammyy Admin, a remote access software.(Citation: Proofpoint TA505 Mar 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Catchamas
Software description: [Catchamas](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0261) is a Windows Trojan that steals information from compromised systems. (Citation: Symantec Catchamas April 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TYPEFRAME
Software description: [TYPEFRAME](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0263) is a remote access tool that has been used by [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032). (Citation: US-CERT TYPEFRAME June 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ShadowPad
Software description: [ShadowPad](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0596) is a modular backdoor that was first identified in a supply chain compromise of the NetSarang software in mid-July 2017. The malware was originally thought to be exclusively used by [APT41](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0096), but has since been observed to be used by various Chinese threat activity groups. (Citation: Recorded Future RedEcho Feb 2021)(Citation: Securelist ShadowPad Aug 2017)(Citation: Kaspersky ShadowPad Aug 2017) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ThreatNeedle
Software description: [ThreatNeedle](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0665) is a backdoor that has been used by [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032) since at least 2019 to target cryptocurrency, defense, and mobile gaming organizations.  It is considered to be an advanced cluster of [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032)'s Manuscrypt (a.k.a. NukeSped) malware family.(Citation: Kaspersky ThreatNeedle Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Mosquito
Software description: [Mosquito](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0256) is a Win32 backdoor that has been used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010). [Mosquito](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0256) is made up of three parts: the installer, the launcher, and the backdoor. The main backdoor is called CommanderDLL and is launched by the loader program. (Citation: ESET Turla Mosquito Jan 2018)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Action RAT
Software description: [Action RAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1028) is a  remote access tool written in Delphi that has been used by [SideCopy](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1008) since at least December 2021 against Indian and Afghani government personnel.(Citation: MalwareBytes SideCopy Dec 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Lizar
Software description: [Lizar](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0681) is a modular remote access tool written using the .NET Framework that shares structural similarities to [Carbanak](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0030). It has likely been used by [FIN7](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0046) since at least February 2021.(Citation: BiZone Lizar May 2021)(Citation: Threatpost Lizar May 2021)(Citation: Gemini FIN7 Oct 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: KeyBoy
Software description: [KeyBoy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0387) is malware that has been used in targeted campaigns against members of the Tibetan Parliament in 2016.(Citation: CitizenLab KeyBoy Nov 2016)(Citation: PWC KeyBoys Feb 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Clambling
Software description: [Clambling](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0660) is a modular backdoor written in C++ that has been used by [Threat Group-3390](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0027) since at least 2017.(Citation: Trend Micro DRBControl February 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ZxxZ
Software description: [ZxxZ](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1013) is a trojan written in Visual C++ that has been used by [BITTER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1002) since at least August 2021, including against Bangladeshi government personnel.(Citation: Cisco Talos Bitter Bangladesh May 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: OopsIE
Software description: [OopsIE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0264) is a Trojan used by [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049) to remotely execute commands as well as upload/download files to/from victims. (Citation: Unit 42 OopsIE! Feb 2018)
Platforms

entities.name: FLOODED AMMYY
entities.description: FlawedAmmyy is a remote access tool (RAT) that was first seen in early 2016, based on leaked source code for a version of Ammyy Admin.

entities.name: CATCHAMAS
entities.description: Catchamas is a Windows Trojan that steals information from compromised systems, first identified in April 2018.

entities.name: TYPEFRAME
entities.description: TYPEFRAME is a remote access tool used by Lazarus Group, first identified in June 2018.

entities.name: SHADOWPAD
entities.description: ShadowPad is a modular backdoor first identified in a supply chain compromise of NetSarang software in mid-July 2017, originally thought to be used exclusively by APT41.

entities.name: THREATNEEDLE
entities.description: ThreatNeedle is a backdoor used by Lazarus Group since at least 2019, targeting cryptocurrency, defense, and mobile gaming organizations.

entities.name: MOSQUITO
entities.description: Mosquito is a Win32 backdoor used by Turla, consisting of an installer, launcher, and backdoor.

entities.name: ACTION RAT
entities.description: Action RAT is a remote access tool used by SideCopy against Indian and Afghani government personnel since at least December 2021.

entities.name: LIZAR
entities.description: Lizar is a modular remote access tool used by FIN7 since at least February 2021, sharing structural similarities to Carbanak.

entities.name: KEYBOY
entities.description: KeyBoy is malware used in targeted campaigns against members of the Tibetan Parliament in 2016.

entities.name: CLAMBLING
entities.description: Clambling is a modular backdoor used by Threat Group-3390 since at least 2017.

entities.name: ZXXZ
entities.description: ZxxZ is a trojan used by BITTER since at least August 2021, including against Bangladeshi government personnel.

entities.name: OOPSIE
entities.description: OopsIE is a Trojan used by OilRig to remotely execute commands and upload/download files to/from victims.

entities.name: APT41
entities.description: APT41 is a Chinese cyber espionage group known for its sophisticated cyber attacks and use of malware such as ShadowPad.

entities.name: TURNA
entities.description: Turla is a Russian cyber espionage group known for its advanced persistent threat (APT) activities and use of malware like Mosquito.

entities.name: SIDECOPY
entities.description: SideCopy is a hacking group that has targeted Indian and Afghani government personnel using tools like Action RAT.

entities.name: FIN7
entities.description: FIN7 is a cybercriminal group known for its sophisticated attacks on businesses, particularly in the retail and hospitality sectors, and has used tools like Lizar.

entities.name: BITTER
entities.description: BITTER is a hacking group that has targeted government personnel in Bangladesh and has used malware like ZxxZ.

entities.name: OILRIG
entities.description: OilRig is an Iranian cyber espionage group known for its use of malware like OopsIE to target various sectors.)<|COMPLETE|>
